SEARCH
Package com.socslingo.managers

Class SceneManager

java.lang.Object
com.socslingo.managers.SceneManager
public class SceneManager extends Object
Singleton class responsible for managing and switching between different scenes in the application.

This class handles the loading, caching, and transitioning of scenes such as login, registration, and main home. It utilizes the ControllerManager to instantiate controllers with their dependencies.

Since:
2024-09-18
Version:
1.0
Author:
TEAM-SOCSLINGO

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static SceneManager getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of SceneManager.

      If the instance does not exist, it is created. Otherwise, the existing instance is returned.

      Returns:
      the singleton instance of SceneManager

    • initialize

      public void initialize(javafx.stage.Stage stage, double width, double height) throws IOException
      Initializes the SceneManager with the primary stage and preloads necessary scenes.

      This method sets the primary stage dimensions and preloads scenes like login, registration, and main home for quicker access during scene switches.

      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage of the application
      width - the desired width of the application window
      height - the desired height of the application window
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during scene preloading

    • switchTo

      public void switchTo(String sceneName)
      Switches to a preloaded scene.

      This method sets the scene associated with the provided scene name to the primary stage.

      Parameters:
      sceneName - the unique name identifier of the scene to switch to

    • loadAndSwitchTo

      public void loadAndSwitchTo(String sceneName, String fxmlPath, String cssPath)
      Loads a new scene that wasn't preloaded and caches it.

      This method dynamically loads a scene from the specified FXML and CSS files, caches it, and then switches to it.

      Parameters:
      sceneName - the unique name identifier for the scene
      fxmlPath - the path to the FXML layout file
      cssPath - the path to the CSS stylesheet file

    • getScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getScene(String sceneName)
      Retrieves a preloaded scene by its name.

      This method allows access to cached scenes for situations where direct manipulation is needed.

      Parameters:
      sceneName - the unique name identifier of the scene
      Returns:
      the Scene associated with the provided name, or null if not found
